headline.main: Man Shot, Held in Brussels Linked to Foiled Paris Plot
headline.print_headline: Man Shot, Held in Brussels Linked to Foiled Paris Plot

docs.snippet: Belgian prosecutors confirmed on Friday a man shot and detained in a police operation in the Brussels district of Schaerbeek was linked to a planned attack in France, foiled by the French authorities on Thursday....
docs.lead_paragraph: Belgian prosecutors confirmed on Friday a man shot and detained in a police operation in the Brussels district of Schaerbeek was linked to a planned attack in France, foiled by the French authorities on Thursday.

headline.main: Exxon Mobil in Talks to Buy Into Eni's Giant Mozambique Gas Field-Sources
headline.print_headline: Exxon Mobil in Talks to Buy Into Eni's Giant Mozambique Gas Field-Sources

docs.snippet: Exxon Mobil is in talks to buy a stake of around 15 percent in Italian oil major Eni's giant Area 4 gas field in Mozambique, two sources familiar with the matter said....
docs.lead_paragraph: Exxon Mobil is in talks to buy a stake of around 15 percent in Italian oil major Eni's giant Area 4 gas field in Mozambique, two sources familiar with the matter said.

headline.main: Job Totals Trail Pre-Recession Levels in 10 US States
headline.print_headline: Job Totals Trail Pre-Recession Levels in 10 US States

docs.snippet: Ten U.S. states still have not regained all the jobs they lost in the Great Recession, even after six and a half years of recovery, while many more have seen only modest gains....
docs.lead_paragraph: Ten U.S. states still have not regained all the jobs they lost in the Great Recession, even after six and a half years of recovery, while many more have seen only modest gains.

headline.main: Chicago Civic Leaders Urge Local Choice for Next Top Cop
headline.print_headline: Chicago Civic Leaders Urge Local Choice for Next Top Cop

docs.snippet: After a decade of outsiders serving as Chicago's police chief, local politicians and church leaders are pushing for an insider to take charge of the 12,000-member force after a history of police shootings that have damaged public trust in the depa...
docs.lead_paragraph: After a decade of outsiders serving as Chicago's police chief, local politicians and church leaders are pushing for an insider to take charge of the 12,000-member force after a history of police shootings that have damaged public trust in the department.

headline.main: Jury: Gilead Owes Merck $200M in Damages Over Drug Patents
headline.print_headline: Jury: Gilead Owes Merck $200M in Damages Over Drug Patents

docs.snippet: The federal jury in a patent trial has ordered drugmaker Gilead Sciences to pay Merck $200 million in damages for infringing on patents for hepatitis C drugs....
docs.lead_paragraph: The federal jury in a patent trial has ordered drugmaker Gilead Sciences to pay Merck $200 million in damages for infringing on patents for hepatitis C drugs.

headline.main: U.S. Indicts Iranians for Hacking Dozens of Banks, New York Dam
headline.print_headline: U.S. Indicts Iranians for Hacking Dozens of Banks, New York Dam

docs.snippet: Seven Iranian hackers conducted a coordinated cyber attack on dozens of U.S. banks, causing millions of dollars in lost business, and tried to shut down a New York dam, the U.S. government said on Thursday in an indictment that for the first time ...
docs.lead_paragraph: Seven Iranian hackers conducted a coordinated cyber attack on dozens of U.S. banks, causing millions of dollars in lost business, and tried to shut down a New York dam, the U.S. government said on Thursday in an indictment that for the first time accused individuals tied to another country of trying to disrupt critical infrastructure.
